alert.note: Alert for Elmore; Lowndes; Montgomery (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 09 at 3:20AM CST until January 09 at 7:45AM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Elmore, Lowndes and Montgomery. * WHEN...Until 630 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 320 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Montgomery, Prattville, Millbrook, Wetumpka, Tallassee, Fort Deposit, Mosses, Hayneville, Pike Road, Elmore, Coosada, Deatsville, Eclectic, Gordonville, Alabama State University, Alabama State Capitol, Montgomery Riverwalk Stadium, Montgomery Zoo, Gunter Air Force Base and Boylston.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
